issue.title: teach the player to [Q]uiver in tutorial2
issue.body:
The tutorial asked the player to [f]ire or auto-[p]hire boomerangs. Neither of these commands work unless the player already has an item quivered.

Teach the player about [Q] first and also mention [F]ire-no-quiver.

Wording is admittedly a bit awkward.

It looks like this in console
![image](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/assets/7819240/b9204d12-4ead-4071-af89-b16aa1167e52)

like this in local tiles (the awkward new line after "If quivered, you" is only present in the ctrl+p message log. Other tutorial messages have this issue too)
![image](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/assets/7819240/f0d7bf00-6763-4251-8ee9-fad886bed85c)

comment.body: I forgot to mention tutorial 2 does mention [Q]uiver already but only at the end of the level, after it is needed.

issue.title: Xom-themed vaults for Crypt and Abyss

labels.name: vaults
labels.description: Issues related to vaults, vault design, new vaults, etc

issue.body: Crypt end and Abyss rune vaults, both with Xom flavor.  Both have themes of chaos effects, mutations, demons, and dancing weapons.

comment.body:
Xom Abyss rune vault: As far as adjusting the monster count, the first thing I'd do is drop one of the apocalypse crabs, and push the remaining one closer to the rune.  Also, my placement of runelights was sort of arbitrary, that might need to be adjusted too.

Xom Crypt end: Looking at this now, the large swarm of derived undead on either side of the entrance should probably be removed.  The wave of zombies and etc is funny, but I'm sure there are more interesting ways to use the space.

Yes, feel free to adjust these as necessary.  I hope you'll be conservative with changes to the Abyss rune vault, though, since I like the way that one turned out.

issue.title: Xom-themed vaults for Crypt and Abyss

labels.name: vaults
labels.description: Issues related to vaults, vault design, new vaults, etc

issue.body: Crypt end and Abyss rune vaults, both with Xom flavor.  Both have themes of chaos effects, mutations, demons, and dancing weapons.

comment.body:
The Xom Abyss rune vault is pretty cool, building off of evilmike_abyss_rune_tso_outpost as well as that rare Xom angel thing. I'd probably adjust the monster distribution and count a little bit- opening a door to dancing weapons and daevas, only for there to be even more groups a bit further in, is pretty tough on the threat count. A few like macabre_mess, seething_liches, and horror_hoard are somewhat comparable, but that's only a few of the 18 abyss rune vaults. Still, it's got a hook and a good shape.

The Xom Crypt end I've got a few concerns over. It's extremely monster dense and uses thin walls with open corridors, so it's going to outpour several dozen monsters from the very start. We do have one Crypt end that does something like that in lightli_unholy_cathedral, but that vault is pretty high up on my branch ends nerfing list. Also, well. Crawl inherited a kinda strange split of branches over time, where some are pretty loose agglomerations of multiple themes and some are pretty restrained by top-down flavour requirements (looking at you, Snake). Crypt falls into the latter category and thus has less variety than many branches (plus already containing necromantic demons), but I'm still not much of a fan of putting non-summoned neqoxecs or cacodemons in the pretty cohesively undead branch. Xom flavour only goes so far, and getting mutated by a neqoxec in a branch one wouldn't expect them in amongst a dozen derived undead isn't much fun.

If you're okay with it, I can tweak these vaults a fair bit (probably adjusting the latter into another large vault for Depths, which has both undead and demons plenty) once you give me permission so they may be finally merged in.

pull_request.title: Two Swamp entries
pull_request.body:
- "Lozenge Pond" has two tough Swamp monsters but a layout that facilitates either fighting now or fleeing.
- "Angry Trees" has a lot of trees and spriggan druids and/or dryads to liven things up

commits.message:
Two Swamp entries (#3240)

[Committer's note: Thickened walls in the former vault to reduce the
chance noise makes them wander out of the vault, and removed bunyips
while mildly downgrading some of the threat in case they wake up anyway.
Reduced spriggan druid count and removed dryads + teleport closets from
the latter vault. (Monsters that don't exist outside of spells are not
currently accepted vault contents. We had cut out druids from Lair many
years ago, but they're relatively weak in Swamp these days?...) Also,
cleaned up both headers.

Closes #3240.]

repo.name: crawl
repo.description: Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup official repository

commits.message:
feat:Talisman vault (#3211)

Small vault that places a talisman and corresponding monsters/scenery.

[Committer's note: Limited the sets per branch in terms of threat level and
branch theme, so there's no autoexploring into a Lair dancing weapon or
a Mines air elemental + raiju band. Cleaned up the header, added more of a
border, a door, and the patrolling tag so they wander away a lot less from
the vault theming, since most of these are pretty out-of-depth. Made threat
monsters not sit on top of the talisman so one doesn't miss the reason to
bother with the vault. Give each of them a small chance of being a randart.

Closes #3211.]

issue.title: Add ghostly pirate ship vault.

labels.name: vaults
labels.description: Issues related to vaults, vault design, new vaults, etc

issue.body: Add a pirate ship vault containing various spooky inhabitants. Including the undead captain with his cutlass. Also, the feared Kraken in the lore is present. Play testing this vault seems to have been fine but it may require more tuning.

comment.body:
The vault concept is pretty solid, and I like the efforts to scale it for such a broad number of branches. There's a lot of different monsters that are pretty harmless for such a deep-placing vault, though (wights, phantoms, electric eels, Depths flying skulls); while some minor degree of flavour spawns are fine for a vault, particularly higher numbers of them can both feel tedious and make one miss any actual threats in the vault. The header's a bit disorganized, too (like a pile of KITEM definitions that could be just one ITEM line), and some trial placements in Depths clearly generates some teleport islands of shallow water amongst deep water.

If you're okay with it, I'm willing to go through and fix this up myself, whenever you confirm such, to make this vaults merge-able.

issue.title: Tutorial popup message runs off the screen
issue.body:
<!-- When reporting a dcss bug, please include answers to the following
    questions, replacing or deleting the text between angle-bracketed comments
    like this one. -->

**PLATFORM and OS or BROWSER:**
webtiles (bug not present in local tiles). Firefox. 1080x1920 resolution

**DCSS VERSION AND GAME INFORMATION:**
0.31-a0-963-ga325b2283a trunk / 0.30.1 stable tutorial

**DESCRIPTION:**
I died to a wyvern in the part 2 tutorial (tragic) (unavoidable /j). 

The message box containing the message assuring me that there will be more deaths to come doesn't fit in the game because the text doesn't wrap to the next line.

**EXTRA FILES:**
![image](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/assets/7819240/c660483b-e1d2-4b8b-83cb-0488cb47afa0)

commits.message:
fix: various issues with webtiles use item mode cycle

Toggling modes in this menu in webtiles was incredibly buggy, because
menu info was not fully updated (headers could become hoverable, tiles
stuck around, etc). This commit fixes every issue that I was able to
find.

(cherry picked from commit 8a8ce12e040e71d77263aca0d9906178d37beae4)

fix: various issues with webtiles use item mode cycle

Toggling modes in this menu in webtiles was incredibly buggy, because
menu info was not fully updated (headers could become hoverable, tiles
stuck around, etc). This commit fixes every issue that I was able to
find.

issue.title: Crash involving fear
issue.body:
**PLATFORM and OS or BROWSER:**
online console, CBR2 as jejorda2

**DCSS VERSION AND GAME INFORMATION:**
0.31-a0-963-ga325b2283a


**DESCRIPTION:**
I fought a group of enemies, including a satyr that gave me the "Fear" status.
I walked through a transporter, which put an enclosing transparent wall between me and the satyr.
I killed a few enemies, then tried to move. Then the game crashed.

**EXTRA FILES:**

ASSERT((duration[DUR_AFRAID] > 0) == !fearmongers.empty()) in 'fearmonger.cc' at line 56 failed.

We crashed! This is likely due to a bug in Crawl.
Please submit a bug report to:
    https://github.com/crawl/crawl/issues
and include at least:
- The crash report: /dgldir/morgue/jejorda2/crash-jejorda2-20231025-185016.txt
- Your save file: /crawl-master/crawl-git-a325b2283a/saves/jejorda2.cs
- Information about your computer and game version: Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup 0.31-a0-963-ga325b2283a (Console/Webtiles)
- A description of what you were doing when this crash occurred.

commits.message:
Tone down talisman prices (Lici)

These values were a bit too high.

pull_request.title: Remove Upheaval friendly fire
pull_request.body:
Makes Upheaval (and consequently Disaster area) do no damage to Elemental Forces. Other allies are still affected, for thematic and consistency reasons.

This change has two benefits; firstly, it removes the incentive to remain at 16.66 invocations (the level at which Upheaval AoE is consistently 1, allowing reliable upheavals against adjacent enemies), and secondly it removes the awkwardness of using elemental force and disaster area in conjunction.

commits.message: Fix a randart talisman gen bug
Add prices for randart talismans & staves

feat: Add damage and noise to evoker descriptions

For the XP evokers that do direct damage and have casting or effect
noises, namely the Tin of Tremorstones, Phial of Floods, and Lightning
Rod, show the current damage die and noise values in the item
descriptions, like we already do for wands.

The Lightning Rod damage situation is a bit complicated due to arc
length decreasing the damage, but we mention this now in the main
description text.

feat: Add evokable item damage to clua

This added an evoke_damage string field giving the damage dice display
seen when examining the item in the UI. This works for wands and XP
evokers that deal direct damage.

Add randart talismans

This has been planned from the start of talismans. Should add some
occasional spice to talismans - more excitement when you find a
strong one, tough decisions when you find an earlier form with good
randart props or a later one with bad props, etc.

pull_request.title: Two Shoals entries
pull_request.body:
1. "Four Pools" has four rooms connected by corridors, all in shallow water.  One of the rooms has the Shoals entry, one has a tough Shoals monster (not necessarily the same room) and the other rooms have one merfolk each.
2. "Watcher in the Water" has a kraken guarding the Shoals entry.  It is in a tiny pool and the player can get out of LOS within the vault.  A lot of plants between the room entrance and the kraken protect autoexplorers.

labels.name: vaults
labels.description: Issues related to vaults, vault design, new vaults, etc

repo.name: crawl
repo.description: Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup official repository

repo.name: crawl
repo.description: Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup official repository

commits.message:
A Shoals entry and an Orc decorative vault (#3230)

 * Four pools, three merfolk or a tougher monster, one per pool.
 * A kraken in a very tiny pool in an oval room.

[Committer's notes: Heavy header clean-up. The first of these has been
altered for far less plants to let autoexplore actually find the Shoals
entry, and swaps out a blind autoexploring into a sea snake in Lair
for a manticore instead. The plants might hypothetically provide some
warning, but if other monsters roar right beside the walls the vault
monsters are likely to tear right through the plants.

The second of these was a kraken Shoals entrance, blocked off by plants.
There's something to be said for how kraken don't really feel much
intimidating any more these days, but there's too much that's awkward
with the use of such in Lair: it's not actually super plausible for a
Lair character to deal enough damage at full range to get the free XP, but
it's both tempting and very tedious to try, plus one can actually just get
mangled doing it. For want of another obvious use for it, the vault's name
vaguely points it at putting it in some mines instead, as one of a million
glass vaults; they didn't kill it and neither should you. Could use
another vault PR to go guarantee Orc:1 decor, maybe?...

Closes #3230.]

Describe forms in the A-menu

Yet more prep for randart forms.

fix: Save compat for vitrifying gaze

In saved games that upgraded across 492612b1e5, floating eyes silently kept
their paralysis gaze after becoming glass eyes, and lost the need to charge
to activate the effect, giving those bugged glass eyes the ability to spam
paralyse.

This commit hopefully fixes any remaining affected saves, by upgrading
those mons to gain vitrifying gaze.
